documents.document: @canonstevejones no, that's your flawed interpretation of his actions. Your opinions and analysis are not 'facts'.
@grangecardiff OK thank you. That design looks impressive. I'm very glad to hear the cafe is staying open.
Does anyone know whether the Black and White Cafe in Grangetown, Cardiff is closed for good, or is just being radically renovated?
@bigraceking @nightingaleitv Lol. I can't say that's ever happened to me watching 3D. Vague disappointment watching football in 3D though.
@bigraceking @nightingaleitv And those TV Times glasses weren't really that much inferior to modern 3D glasses.
@Hayley____ Hayley ❤️'s Rover. Nah, that's not going to work.
Neil Warnock is exactly what Cardiff City needs at the moment.
Speaker Bercow is calling a LOT of SNP members to speak, all of whom are making more-or-less the same point.
He's very bright and well informed on constitutional history and parliamentary procedure. https://t.co/71NDwnDE1s
@Hayley____ It depends what the name is...
@nightingaleitv ITV used to show 3D films as long ago as the early 1980s, usually late on Fridays I think. Glasses given away with TV Times.
@canonstevejones No 'but', truth is truth, and lies are lies.
Erm, Bill Pertwee was never a Dr Who........... https://t.co/Gni4Trai6u
I actually DON'T support the measures President Trump has taken on Muslims, but that doesn't give me the right to report on them dishonestly
There is no 'Muslim ban'. Any journalist who uses that phrase is being utterly dishonest and is a disgrace to the profession.
Here is Robert Mugabe on a State visit to Britain in 1994. Not many MPs questioned his human rights record: https://t.co/vmwGOQcVCU
Here is President Assad and his wife on a State visit to Britain in 2002. Where were today's protesters/MPs then?: https://t.co/eReplR9wkr
Most of the grandstanding we saw in Parliament today did not take place when dignitaries from China, Saudi Arabia & others visited Britain.
Let's also not forget Ed Miliband's support for the bombing of Libya in 2011, which plunged a successful country into warring chaos.
@iainlee Mandela effect = people young at the time misremembering his prostate health scare in the 1980s, which he recovered from.
Yep, it's a wind-up..... https://t.co/24m9XQiq8Z
I really, really hope this is a parody account for The sake of your sanity... https://t.co/JOzolX3Bpx
The truth is papers like the Daily Mirror are dying. Their readership consists mostly of elderly people who don't know how to use computers.
I thinking knowing what you're protesting about, why, and what you're hoping to achieve, would be a good start. https://t.co/NtoqZ14aMI
If I bought the Daily Mirror, I'd now be boycotting it. I'll refuse to buy it for others if asked. Its standards ha… https://t.co/lU8VhD14bS
The mentality of the protester.... https://t.co/2QATxKBtVx
@archiebland I was sorry to hear about your dad, a man I had a great respect for, especially during the LWT era. Take care.
I am completely opposed to torture - it doesn't work, and it would make things much less safe for American and possibly British troops.
ITV should move #Peston to a live slot on Sunday nights and drop Sunday mornings, which are already overcrowded with Marr, Neil and Ridge.
Look at the Brexit vote in Labour heartlands in the north and in the Welsh Valleys - that counts for more than party membership #Peston
@SDoughtyMP I'm glad you're consistent at least. Thank you for answering honestly.
Robert Peston just said 'most Labour members' wouldn't want Article 50 triggered. Maybe, but not the case with Labour voters #Peston
Michael van Gerwen is in a different class to everyone else now, even when he's not at his absolute best #darts
@SDoughtyMP So would you sign a petition to stop President Xi Jinping or King Salman from being granted a State vis… https://t.co/oA5xNxfVuk
Not really possible. The BBC couldn't get its hands on any horse racing rights for several years for starters. It's… https://t.co/mPlX8ooqhv
Notice how quickly Barack Obama's policy on Haitian refugees has been forgotten...
I wonder whether Stephen Doughty was quite so active when the likes of Assad and Mugabe & several Chinese president… https://t.co/pEIj8v61Y4
Donald Trump has not banned Muslims from entering the USA. Just so you know....
A terrific night of #darts ahead on ITV4. The best four players on the planet have made it through to the semi-finals.
@Chris180Mason Agreed. They've been hired because they're 'names', not because they're good pundits.
@AndrewClarke19 He certainly is, Andy.
@leeselby126 The judges got it about right for me. I hope you're OK Lee. I feel sorry for you today.
@pistol147 @RealCFrampton The judges got it about right for me, but huge credit to both fighters. Let's have a third bout!
The judges got that one about right. Both Santa Cruz and Frampton are a credit to boxing. Let's have a third fight in Ireland!
Best wishes to Alex Lester and Janice Long for the future. Axing live programming on Radio 2 is an absurd decision by BBC management.
@ImAndyMcColl I'm glad to hear it, Andy. I've admired his work for a long time.
@Chris180Mason terrific ITV coverage as always Chris.
Congratulations to Serena Williams. It's phenomenal and she's been around for a very long time now.
@meganbootITV hi Megan, I replied to Andy Collinson's email but haven't heard from him since. 3 of us to do a conference call next week?
It never recovered from the year Man Utd didn't participate. Plus top 4 in Premier League getting into Champions Le… https://t.co/yqNRllcBdu
Spurs were very fortunate to win. Wycombe put up a good fight.
Kermogant came back to haunt Cardiff City this afternoon.
Sir John Hurt was a superb actor. I particularly enjoyed him in The Elephant Man, 1984 and The Alan Clark Diaries. A sad loss. RIP.
@RoundLike @BBC There's not a huge amount he can do for 'retribution'. She's one of many who asks him absurd questions.
@RoundLike @BBC Nah I think he was only having a laugh with that remark. He's used to daft questions from pro-establishment journalists.
@M_Occomore @SocialistVoice @TelegraphNews I tweeted that article very widely earlier this evening. He's been treated disgracefully.
@annispice @CSquireMagazine Thanks for pointing me in that direction.
@RoundLike @BBC There's a serious institutional bias issue for sure. Ian Katz, ex-Guardian deputy, is editor.
Thanks for clarifying! Ha! Ha! https://t.co/BPCpvEgret
@annispice I can't stand the bloke.
@OldGeezerAl I rarely drink when in the flat on my own...
@GwenSteph88 I certainly hope so.
Can't 'SURVIVE'? This guy is beyond absurd. https://t.co/riX4c9zr1e
James O'Brien is an awful presenter of #Newsnight
@PhilomenaPound @TelegraphNews I hope he finds radio work elsewhere.
@wirelessradiouk Brian Matthew is in good health and is available for work. A good fit for The Wireless? I think so. Go for it, I say!
@PhilPurnell Well, most BBC management these days are Islington elitist types who don't have a clue what ordinary people want.
@GwenSteph88 It's possible another station could snap him up. Age UK's online station The Wireless would be a good home. Shameful BBC.
@GwenSteph88 No, not ill health. He's been dropped against his will. From the man himself: https://t.co/V3TifbEYiv

@BuddyGB Tony's under-used by the BBC at the moment. Most of his radio work is on commercial stations these days.
@BuddyGB Thought so :-)
@BuddyGB Most likely scenario - Dermot O'Leary gets a Saturday breakfast show. SOTS moves to a new off-peak slot with Tony Blackburn.
@BuddyGB John Birt? What's he got to do with it? He's long gone. Don't you mean Tony Hall?
@BuddyGB To be fair to Tim, he's effectively reading Brian's script, so can't make it his own. Tony a likely successor in new slot.
@shadowrangler @SocialistVoice Erm, Man U were top for so long largely because they brought through a lot of academy players. Work it out...
@shadowrangler @SocialistVoice I agree football has less connection with the community nowadays, but I don't blame players for taking money.
@shadowrangler @SocialistVoice Well yes, but a footballer's career is short and I don't blame them for making as much money as possible.
@shadowrangler @SocialistVoice @fastestfredy A separate argument about the amount they're paid. Sports sponsorship existed in 1966, BTW.
@shadowrangler @SocialistVoice @fastestfredy Eh? Sponsorship in sport is essential if you want sports professionals to be paid.
@SocialistVoice @fastestfredy @shadowrangler There will be serious implications for sports sponsorship if that actually happens.
@SocialistVoice @pvtjen Yes JY was very badly treated in 2002, but he returned to Radio 2 for a 90th birthday celebration.
@SocialistVoice @shadowrangler I don't see much evidence of that myself. The BBC got a decent licence fee settlement but uses money badly.
